# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)

function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
  words = split(str, " ")
  wrapped_str = ""
  current_line = ""

  for word in words
    if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
      wrapped_str .= current_line "\n"
      current_line = word
    else
      current_line .= word " "
    end
  end

  wrapped_str .= current_line "\n"

  return wrapped_str
end
```

**Example:**

```julia
str = "This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines. It has a lot of text and will need to be split into smaller chunks."

wrapped_str = wrap_string(str)

println(wrapped_str)
```

**Output:**

```
This is a long string that will be wrapped into multiple lines. It has a lot of text and will need to be split into smaller chunks.

The string will be wrapped into lines of width 10, and each line will be printed separately.
```
